entry.title: Maruxa and Coralia Fandiño Ricart (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Maruxa and Coralia Fandiño Ricart (statues pictured) became famous in Galicia because their bright, colourful outfits contrasted with the social repression of Francoist Spain?

entry.title: fourth great age of Christian expansion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the growth of Christianity in 20th-century Africa has been termed the "fourth great age of Christian expansion"?

entry.title: Augustus Belknap (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Augustus Belknap led the first mule-drawn car from Alamo Plaza to San Pedro Springs Park, which developed into the first streetcar line in San Antonio?

entry.title: a library built for African Americans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that land for a library built for African Americans in Virginia was donated by Pope Pius XII?

entry.title: Geno (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite knowing of Geno's popularity, Super Mario RPG's co-director wasn't sure why the character was popular?

entry.title: D-Date (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Japanese boy band D-Date promoted a song through a short film in which the audience had to guess who the traitor was?

entry.title: Big Foot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nicki Minaj's song "Big Foot" is a diss track about Megan Thee Stallion?

entry.title: Dr. Disaster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dr. Disaster's office collapsed in an earthquake on this day in 2011?
